Title: As Pope Francis goes home
Summary: The world has paid its respects to Pope Francis . The 'exequies' or papal funeral rites were a fitting tribute to a life of service . The Pope continued the humility of his earthly journey by insisting he not be buried in the pomp and grandiosity of Saint Peter’s Basilica .

Title: Ministry targets $6bn investment to stimulate productive economy
Summary: Federal Minister of Industry, Trade and Investment (FMITI), Dr Jumoke Oduwole, has said the ministry has set an ambitious, yet achievable target to facilitate $6 billion in foreign investment into Nigeria’s productive economy .

Title: Nigerian man jailed for $6m inheritance scam targeting 400 elderly Americans
Summary: Nigerian national, Okezie Bonaventure Ogbata, 36, was sentenced on Friday to 97 months in U.S. federal prison for orchestrating a $6 million transnational inheritance fraud scheme .

Title: Public sector deficit, borrowing, threat to $1trn economy – NACCIMA, OPS

Title: FCTA destroys 600 seized motorcycles from restricted areas
Summary: The Federal Capital Territory Administration crushed no fewer than 601 motorcycles impounded for violating traffic regulations in Abuja . The development reinforced its ongoing campaign against the use of commercial motorcycles popularly known as okadas within prohibited areas of the city . The action was backed by existing laws aimed at enhancing both security and traffic order in the capital .

Title: Nigeria scraps BEA scholarship with beneficiaries stranded abroad
Summary: The Federal Government on Tuesday announced the cancellation of the Bilateral Education Agreement scholarship programme . The BEA programme had allowed hundreds of Nigerian students to pursue higher education overseas on government sponsorship . The decision follows months of complaints by stranded Nigerian scholars abroad who accused the government of failing to meet its financial obligations under the scheme .

Title: Ataga: Police forced me to write false statement, says Chidinma
Summary: Chidinma Ojukwu is standing trial for the alleged murder of the Chief Executive Officer of Super TV, Michael Usifo Ataga . The former 300-level Mass Communication student said fear prevented her from speaking the truth during her interactions with the police . She is facing charges of stealing and forgery .
